intro: Dicoma quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined dicoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, with five distinct veins running along their length. Dicoma quinquenervia produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
